base: Multiple bases during retreat: Elmas, Sardinia (Oct 29-Nov 9), El Aouina, Tunisia (Nov 9-20), Djedeida (Nov 20-Dec 2), Protville (Dec 2-31)

operations_history.operation: Second Battle of El Alamein (initial operations)
Withdrawal to Sardinia under Fliegerkorps X
Allied advance operations - heavy losses to P-40s
Retreat from Gambut to Marble Arch

metadata.notes: II./StG 3 formed from I./StG 1 on 13 January 1942 at El Agheila/Agedabia. Unit underwent significant operational stress during Q4 1942: withdrew to Sardinia Oct 29 for anti-shipping operations under Fliegerkorps X, returned to Tunisia Nov 9, suffered catastrophic losses Nov 11 (8 aircraft to P-40s), continued retreat through Libya (Gambut, Marble Arch, Nofilia), deployed to Tunisia December for Battle of Tebourba. Hauptmann Heinrich Heine commanded throughout this period (Jul 1942 - Apr 1943). Unit reported 29 Ju 87D-3/Trop on 1 Jan 1943, indicating tropicalized variants were standard. Personnel and ordnance estimates based on standard Luftwaffe Stuka Gruppe TO&E adjusted for operational attrition. Supply status 'strained' reflects extended retreat, multiple base relocations (4 bases in 3 months), and Allied air superiority. Source validation: ~65% Tier 1/2 facts (WITW database, Asisbiz.com with citations, TracesOfWar commander dates), ~35% Wikipedia/general sources (operational context, battle dates). Aircraft variant specificity: Ju 87D-3/Trop and Ju 87D-1/Trop confirmed from multiple Tier 2 sources (NOT generic 'Stuka' entries).
metadata.witw_validation: Confirmed in WITW _airgroup.csv: II./StG 3 (line 326, 2523), airType 72 = Ju 87D-series

tier_1_2_facts_confirmed: Commander: Hauptmann Heinrich Heine, Jul 1942 - Apr 1943 (TracesOfWar.com)
Base locations: Elmas (Oct-Nov), El Aouina (Nov 9-20), Djedeida (Nov 20-Dec 2), Protville (Dec 2-31) (Asisbiz.com)
Aircraft variants: Ju 87D-3/Trop, Ju 87D-1/Trop (multiple Tier 2 sources)
Formation date: 13 Jan 1942 from I./StG 1 at El Agheila/Agedabia (Asisbiz.com)
Aircraft strength: 29 Ju 87D-3/Trop on 1 Jan 1943 (multiple sources)
Major operations: Battle of Tebourba Dec 1-10, 1942 (Asisbiz.com, military history sources)
Heavy losses: Nov 11, 1942 - 8 aircraft lost to P-40s (Wikipedia corroborated by operational records)
source_validation.hybrid_validation_notes: Aircraft variants (Ju 87D-3/Trop, Ju 87D-1/Trop) confirmed via multiple Tier 2 sources including technical specifications databases. Unit designation and airType confirmed via WITW Tier 1 database. Commander name and dates confirmed via TracesOfWar.com Tier 2 military personnel database. Base locations and operational timeline confirmed via Asisbiz.com Tier 2 source with primary source citations. Battle participation (El Alamein, Tebourba) confirmed via Wikipedia and cross-referenced with military history databases. Personnel and ordnance estimates derived from standard Luftwaffe Stuka Gruppe TO&E adjusted for operational conditions. Confidence score 72% reflects strong Tier 1/2 validation for unit identity, commander, aircraft variants, and major operations, with some estimates for personnel/ordnance based on standard TO&E rather than specific documentary evidence for this unit-quarter.
